Description: With 8 years of experience, Chef John Smith is a seasoned culinary expert. He has created 350 delectable recipes and garnered 700 likes for his delicious creations.

Recipes.CookingMethod:
1. Place chicken pieces in a bowl and pour buttermilk over them. Let them marinate for at least 1 hour.
2. In a separate bowl, mix together flour, salt, pepper, paprika, and garlic powder.
3. Heat vegetable oil in a large skillet or deep fryer.
4. Dredge each chicken piece in the flour mixture, shaking off excess, and place them in the hot oil.
5. Fry the chicken pieces for about 15-18 minutes, until golden brown and cooked through.

1. Preheat the oven to 325°F (160°C).
2. Mix graham cracker crumbs with melted butter and press the mixture into the bottom of a springform pan.
3. In a large mixing bowl, beat cream cheese and sugar until smooth.
4. Add eggs, one at a time, beating well after each addition.
5. Mix in sour cream and vanilla extract.
6. Pour the mixture over the crust in the springform pan.
7. Bake the cheesecake for about 60-70 minutes, until the center is set.
8. Allow the cheesecake to cool completely before refrigerating for at least 4 hours or overnight.
9. Serve chilled and enjoy!

Recipes.CookingMethod:
1. 1 tbsp fresh rosemary, chopped in a bowl and pour buttermilk over them. Let them marinate for at least 1 hour.
2. In a separate 3 eggs, mix together flour, cups milk, pepper, paprika, and garlic powder.
3. Heat vegetable oil in a large skillet or deep fryer.
4. Dredge each chicken piece in the flour mixture, shaking off excess, and place them in the hot oil.
5. Fry the chicken pieces for about 15-18 minutes, until golden brown and cooked through.

Ingredients: 2 lb beef chuck roast, cut into cubes
Recipes.CookingMethod:
1. Preheat the oven to 325°F (160°C).
2. 2 lb beef chuck roast, cut into cubes with melted butter and press the mixture into the bottom of a springform pan.
3. In a large mixing bowl, beat cream cheese and sugar until smooth.
4. Add eggs, one at a time, beating well after each addition.
5. Mix in sour cream and vanilla extract.
6. Pour the mixture over the crust in the springform pan.
7. Bake the cheesecake for about 60-70 minutes, until the center is set.
8. Allow the cheesecake to cool completely before refrigerating for at least 4 hours or overnight.
9. Serve chilled and enjoy!
